page.title: 09Therfield Heath
page.content: Royston Heath is an area of grassland to the south-west of Royston. It is really called Therfield Heath because most of it is in the parish of Therfield. It has been used for many different things. King James 1 liked to hunt hares and birds there. Later there was a racecourse on the Heath which was more popular than Newmarket,and it has always been used for grazing sheep. Now the Heath is used for all sorts of games: football, cricket, rugby, tennis, shooting and golf. There is a sports club and a golf club. In winter many people go sledging on the Heath. In summer it is good for having walks and picnics. It is very important that we should preserve the Heath. It is very important to the people of Royston.
